intro: Valeriana obtusiloba, commonly known as the broad-leaved valerian, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands. Its roots are used in traditional medicine for their sedative and calming properties. Valeriana obtusiloba is also valued for its ornamental appeal due to its vibrant blooms and robust growth habit.
